gurmukhi: XoN n pwn pry munwbr hoih koit aupwie ] fwr kY qum gXwn jwr su qwsu lyhu ghwie ]
transliteration: Yon Naa Paan Dare Mounndabar Hoh(i) Kottee Oupaae|| Daar Kai Toum Gyaan Jaar Su Taas(u) Leh(u) Gadaae||
translation: “You may take croes of measures except this, you will not be able to catch him;” only throw the net of knowledge and catch him;”

gurmukhi: gXwn jwr jbY niRpM br fwrXo iqh bIc ] qaun jwr gho munwbr jwn dUjÍ dDIc ]142]
transliteration: Gyaan Jaar Jabai Nripan Bar Daryo Tih Beech|| Taoun Jaar Gado Mounndabar Jaan Doojva Dadheech||142||
translation: When the king threw the net of knowledge into the ocean that net caught him like the second Dadhich.142.

gurmukhi: m`C sihq miCMdR jogI b`iD jwr mJwr ] m`C lok iblok kY sB hÍY gey ibsMBwr ]
transliteration: Machchh Sahit Machhindra Jogibaddh(i) Jaar Majhaar|| Machchh Lok Bilok Kai Sabh Hvai Gad Bisanbhaar||
translation: The Yogi Matsyendra was caught alongwith the fish, having been entrapped in the net and seeing that fish all were wonder-struck;

gurmukhi: dÍY mhUrq ibqI jbY suD pwie kY kCu AMg ] BUp dÍwr gey sBY Bt bwNiD AsqR auqMg ]143]
transliteration: Dvai Mahoorat Bitijabai Sudh Paae Kai Kachh(u) An|| Bhoop Dvaar Gad Sabhai Bhat Baandh(i) Astra Outan||143||
translation: After some time, when all the people regained some health, then all the warriors, depositing their arms and weapons reached at the gate of the king.143.

gurmukhi: m`C audr lgy sy cIrn ikauhUM n cIrw jwie ] hir hir prY jbY qb pUC imqR bulwie ]
transliteration: Machchh Udar Lage Se Chderan Kiohoon Na Cheeraa Jaae|| Har(i) Har(i) Darai Jabai Tab Poochh Mitra Bulaae||
translation: They began to rip the belly of the fish, but none of them could do it; when all of them gave in, then the king called his friends and asked them :

gurmukhi: Aaur kaun ibcwrIAY aupkwr qwkr Awj ] idSt jwq pry munISÍr sry hmro kwju ]144]
transliteration: Aur Kaoun Bicdareeai Oupkaar Taakar Aaj|| Disht Jaat Dare Mounndeshvar Dare Hamro Kaaj(u)||144||
translation: “Now what measure be adopted, so that we may be successful in our objective and see the great sage.”144.

gurmukhi: m`C pyt ikhUM n Puty sB kr hty aupwie ] gXwn gurU iqn ko huqo pUCw qwih bnwie ]145]
transliteration: Machchh Pet Kihoon Na Phoute Sabh Kar Hate Oupaae|| Gyaan Guroo Tin Ko Houto Poochhaadtaah(i) Banaae||145||
translation: All of them used their power, but the belly of the fish could not be ripped, then the king tried to ask the knowledge- Guru.145.

gurmukhi: Bt qXwg kY sB grb ] niRp qIr boly srb ] niRp pUCIAY gur gXwn ] kh dyie qoih ibDwn ]146]
transliteration: Bhat Tyaag Kai Sabh Gadab|| Nrip Teer Bole Sarab|| Nrip Poochheeai Gur Gyaan|| Kah De(i) Toh(i) Bidhaan||146||
translation: All the warriors, forsaking their pride, came near the king and spoke, “O king ! ask only the knowledge-Guru, he will only tell us all the method.”146.

gurmukhi: ibD pUr kY suB cwr ] Ar gXwn rIq ibcwr ] gur BwKIAY imh Byv ] ikm dyKIAY muin dyv ]147]
transliteration: Bidh Poor Kai Soubh Chaar|| Ar Gyaan Reet Bichaar|| Gur Bhaakheeai Muh(i) Bhev|| Kim Dekheeai Mounndi) Dev||147||
translation: The king reflected methodically and invoked knowledge and said, “O chief Guru ! tell me the mystery as to how the sage can be seen ?”147.

gurmukhi: gur gXwn bolXo bYn ] suB bwc so suK dYn ] Curkw ibbyk lY hwQ ] ieh PwrIAY iqh swQ ]148]
transliteration: Gur Gyaan Bolyo Bain|| Soubh Baach So Souch Dain|| Chhurkaa Bibek Lai Haath|| Ih Pdareeai Tih Saath||148||
translation: Then the knowledge-Guru uttered these ambrosial words,”O king! Take the knife of Viveka (Discrimination) and tear off this fish.”148.
